summary: This is a legal order from a law enforcement or investigative agency (likely the FBI or a US Attorney's Office) to Bank of America, demanding comprehensive financial records for an investigation. It requests all records, from inception to present, for accounts, organizations, or individuals associated with the identifiers listed under 'EFTA00019755'. The order seeks a wide range of documents including statements, signature cards, wire transfers, safe deposit records, and correspondence.

locations.description: Bank of America N.A. Legal Order Processing center (Christiana IV) where the subpoena is sent.

keyFacts: This is a formal legal order (likely a subpoena or similar) compelling Bank of America to produce extensive financial records for an investigation related to case identifier EFTA00019755.
The scope is extremely broad, requesting 'ALL OPEN AND CLOSED ACCOUNTS' and all records 'from inception to present' for the target(s).

The requested records cover nearly every aspect of banking activity, including transaction documents, identification, wire transfers, safe deposit boxes, online banking data, and all related correspondence.
The order is addressed to the bank's Legal Order Processing department and is to be delivered via FedEx, indicating its official and urgent nature.
The point of contact for questions is listed as a 'Forensic Accountant' at reference number EFTA00019756, confirming this is part of a financial investigation.
